labels.description: Apply this label when an issue is open to proposals by contributors

labels.name: Bug
labels.description: Something is broken. Auto assigns a BugZero manager.

body:
If you haven’t already, check out our [contributing guidelines](https://github.com/Expensify/ReactNativeChat/blob/main/contributingGuides/CONTRIBUTING.md) for onboarding and email contributors@expensify.com to request to join our Slack channel!
___

**Version Number:** 9.2.89-1
**Reproducible in staging?:** Yes
**Reproducible in production?:** No
**If this was caught during regression testing, add the test name, ID and link from BrowserStack:** https://github.com/Expensify/App/pull/78004
**Email or phone of affected tester (no customers):** jsoidjnsdoijsdojso@gmail.com
**Issue reported by:** Applause Internal Team
**Bug source:** Exploratory - Significant User Experience Deterioration
**Device used:** Mac 26.1 / Chrome
**App Component:** Money Requests

## Action Performed:
1. Go to staging.new.expensify.com
2. Go to workspace chat.
3. Click + > Create expense > Manual.
4. Without entering amount, click Currency.
5. Type anything that will not return result.
6. Hit Enter.
7. Click RHP back button.
BUG 1: Error shows up on amount input page.
8. Enter amount.
9. Click Currency.
10. Type anything that will not return result.
11. Hit Enter.
12. Click RHP back button.
BUG 2: RHP opens confirm page instead of amount input page.

## Expected Result:
BUG 1: No error will show up on amount input page.
BUG 2: RHP will return to amount input page.

## Actual Result:
BUG 1: Error shows up on amount input page.
BUG 2: RHP opens confirm page instead of amount input page.

## Workaround:
Unknown

## Platforms:
- [ ] Android: App
- [ ] Android: mWeb Chrome
- [ ] iOS: App
- [ ] iOS: mWeb Safari
- [ ] iOS: mWeb Chrome
- [x] Windows: Chrome
- [x] MacOS: Chrome / Safari

title: [$250] Pass Page Context to Concierge from Side Panel

labels.name: External
labels.description: Added to denote the issue can be worked on by a contributor

labels.name: Daily
labels.description: KSv2

labels.name: Help Wanted
labels.description: Apply this label when an issue is open to proposals by contributors

body:
When a user chats with Concierge from the side panel (RHP), capture a simplified representation of the main app window content html and pass it as part of AddComment as a pageHTML parameter 1. When the user sends a message in the side panel from Concierge or the admins room 2. Capture simplified page html of the main body content (this would include things like semantic HTML elements (buttons, links, headings, menu items, inputs, etc.), visible text content from non-semantic containers, aria-label, href, alt, placeholder attributes where useful 3. Wrap the output with page URL ` ... extracted content ... ` 4. Pass to AddComment API. Add pageHTML parameter to addComment() function and only populate when isInSidePanel is true

___

**Version Number:**
**Reproducible in staging?:** Needs Reproduction (Reproduction blocked)
**Reproducible in production?:** Needs Reproduction
**If this was caught during regression testing, add the test name, ID and link from BrowserStack:**
**Email or phone of affected tester (no customers):**
**Logs:** https://stackoverflow.com/c/expensify/questions/4856
**Expensify/Expensify Issue URL:**
**Issue reported by:** @nyomanjyotisa 
**Slack conversation** (hyperlinked to channel name): [#Open source](https://expensify.slack.com/archives/C01GTK53T8Q/p1766554248072459)

## Action Performed:
Precondition:
- Workspace is connected with Company Cards
- Assign at least one card to a user, then unassign the card
1. Go to Workspace Settings → Company Cards
2. Observe the console errors
## Expected Result:
No hydration errors appear in the console
## Actual Result:
Errors appear in the console
- In HTML, <button> cannot be a descendant of <button>. This will cause a hydration error.
- <button> cannot contain a nested <button>.
## Workaround:
Unknown
## Platforms:
Select the officially supported platforms where the issue was reproduced:

If you haven’t already, check out our [contributing guidelines](https://github.com/Expensify/ReactNativeChat/blob/main/contributingGuides/CONTRIBUTING.md) for onboarding and email contributors@expensify.com to request to join our Slack channel! ___ **Version Number:** v9.2.87-7 **Reproducible in staging?:** Yes **Reproducible in production?:** Yes **If this was caught during regression testing, add the test name, ID and link from BrowserStack:** https://test-management.browserstack.com/projects/2219752/test-runs/TR-2545/41237957/1092911729?q=delete+workspace&issue_type=jira **Email or phone of affected tester (no customers):** applausetester+vq+2712@applause.expensifail.com **Issue reported by:** Applause Internal Team **Bug source:** Exploratory - Significant User Experience Deterioration **Device used:** Windows 10/Chrome **App Component:** Workspace Settings ## Action Performed: Preconditions: Workspace has issued an Expensify card to the member 1. Open the NewDot app 2. Navigate to the Workspace Overview 3. Click on the More button 4. Select the Delete option 5. Click on the Delete button and click on the Got it 6. Navigate to the Workspace tab 7. Click on the three dots button and select Delete 8. Click on the Delete button and click on the Got it ## Expected Result: Step 5: After clicking the " Got it" button, the Delete banner should dismiss like Step 8 ## Actual Result: The Delete banner at step 5 still displays ## Workaround: Unknown ## Platforms: - [x] Android: App - [ ] Android: mWeb Chrome - [x] iOS: App - [ ] iOS: mWeb Safari - [ ] iOS: mWeb Chrome - [x] Windows: Chrome - [ ] MacOS: Chrome / Safari ## Screenshots/Videos https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/818081b2-273f-4d9b-964e-2c4a488bb885 [View all open jobs on GitHub](https://github.com/Expensify/App/issues?q=is%3Aopen+is%3Aissue+label%3A%22Help+Wanted%22)

title: [$250] [Explain feature] Add support for the "Explain" button in the front end

labels.name: Reviewing
labels.description: Has a PR in review

labels.name: External
labels.description: Added to denote the issue can be worked on by a contributor

labels.name: Weekly
labels.description: KSv2

labels.name: NewFeature
labels.description: Something to build that is a new item.

type.name: Feature
type.description: A request, idea, or new functionality

body:
# Part of the "Explain Concierge AI actions" project Main issue: https://github.com/Expensify/Expensify/issues/567869 # Feature Description - For this feature we need to implement an "Explain" button in the frontend for **any report action** that has a `reasoning` field. - This button will exist in the right-click menu for now - To start it will be visible on the following report actions: - Concierge auto-categorized something using AI - Concierge auto-submitted a report - Not shown in mockup: When the user taps explain we will create a comment thread off of the system message - There should be a comment from the user's perspective that says: "Please explain this to me." - Concierge should then respond with reason. **BE Changes are in development now.**
